{"step_by_step_thinking": "Propranolol is a non-selective beta blocker that is used in the treatment of various cardiovascular conditions. However, it has also been found to be effective in the treatment of infantile hemangiomas, which are benign vascular tumors that occur in infants. Lymphangioma, pyogenic granuloma, and capillary malformation are other types of vascular lesions, but propranolol is not the first-line treatment for these conditions.", "answer_choice": "A"}
